info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 7:03PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Heavy Rainfall May Lead to Minor Flooding Across Surry County NC and southern Carroll County VA... ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by heavy rainfall. * WHERE...Portions of north central North Carolina and southwest Virginia, including the following counties, in north central North Carolina, Surry. In southwest Virginia, Carroll. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 701 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas may result in minor flooding within the advisory area including locations such as Fairview, Dobson, and Lambsburg. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen during the past hour. - Fairview, Dobson, Lambsburg is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. This includes the following streams and drainages... Beaverdam Creek, Cooks Creek, Crooked Creek, Bull Creek, Ararat River, Chestnut Creek, Cody Creek, Beaver Creek, Caddle Creek and Brushy Fork. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Airy... Fairview... Dobson... Bottom... Cana... Fancy Gap... and Pine Ridge... - For additional information please go to http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
